articles.title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
articles.description:
Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being hospitalized in critical condition following the Feb. 16 shooting, according to reports.

The post Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after the February 16 Pawtucket ice rink shooting.
This marks the third fatality linked to the shooting incident.
Boston residents are concerned about safety at public events following this tragedy.

articles.title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
articles.description:
Matt Lyons said he climbed 40 to 50 feet to save Pixie, who was stuck up in a tree during Rhode Island's record snowstorm.

The post Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Matt Lyons rescued Pixie, a cat, after it was stuck in a tree for days.
Lyons climbed 40 to 50 feet during Rhode Island's record snowstorm to save the cat.
The incident highlights community efforts and concern for pets during severe weather events.

articles.title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
articles.description:
The Bruins have to play 25 games over the final eight weeks of the 2025-26 season.

The post 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bruins resume play with 25 games in eight weeks post-Olympic break.
Team faces critical decisions ahead of the trade deadline on March 3.
Local fans anticipate playoff positioning as Bruins aim for Stanley Cup contention.

articles.title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
articles.description:
Three incarcerated individuals were treated for smoke inhalation, and one staff member went to the hospital as a precautionary measure.

The post Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Fire broke out at MCI-Norfolk prison on February 25, 2026.
Three incarcerated individuals received treatment for smoke inhalation; one staff member hospitalized as precaution.
No major injuries reported, ensuring safety for surrounding community.
